channel.title: Beginner question regarding shorcuts to $PATH's for snapd
channel.description: Hello - I installed the snapd software for whonix, installed snap app I wanted (wickr), now I'm able to run it from terminal running: snap run wickrpro My questions is: is it possible to create "shortcut" for snap app? Let's say to add it to my favourites and not having to run terminal each time I want to run this app. I'd be thankful for help

item.title: Beginner question regarding shorcuts to $PATH's for snapd
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Probably possible as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle possible.
It’s not a “How to do with Whonix” question but rather “How to do with XFCE” question.

“google”:

how to add xfce desktop shortcuts

Read full topic
item.source: Beginner question regarding shorcuts to $PATH's for snapd

item.title: Beginner question regarding shorcuts to $PATH's for snapd
item.dc:creator: fukkmylife
item.description:
Hello - I installed the snapd software for whonix, installed snap app I wanted (wickr), now I’m able to run it from terminal running:
snap run wickrpro
My questions is: is it possible to create “shortcut” for snap app? Let’s say to add it to my favourites and not having to run terminal each time I want to run this app. I’d be thankful for help

Read full topic
item.source: Beginner question regarding shorcuts to $PATH's for snapd
